column1: Manokwari is a coastal town and the capital of the Indonesian province of West Papua. It is one of only four provincial capitals of Indonesia without a city status. It is also the administrative seat of Manokwari Regency. Majority of Manokwari residents are Christians and the town is one of the seats of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Manokwari–Sorong.

column2: Captain John Hayes in the merchant ships Duke of Clarence and Duchess raised the British flag at Dore Bay
column3: which he called Restoration Bay as he had put in there to restore his crews' health) and claimed it and the surrounding area
column5: for Great Britain. The British established a small settlement there to engage in the spice trade
column6: especially in massoy bark and nutmeg. The British erected a small stockade fort
column8: named in honour of King George III's coronation. For a variety of reasons the British East India Company
column9: including changing priorities consequent on the outbreak of war with France
column10: did not support the settlement. The settlement was not a success and in 1795 the British abandoned it.On 12 April 1942
column11: a Japanese convoy steamed into Dore Bay and began landing approximately 4
column12: 000 men. The area was already well known to the Japanese
column13: as the area was the location of a cotton plantation developed by the government-sponsored Nan’yō Kōhatsu development company from the early 1930s. At the beginning of 1942
column14: the Royal Netherlands East Indies Army (KNIL) garrison at Manokwari consisted of approximately 125 KNIL troops
column15: which included a number of civilians reservists and home guard who had been called up at the start of February 1942. As the KNIL ground force had no chance of successfully engaging the Japanese invasion force
column16: it withdrew into the interior of Dutch New Guinea and initiated guerilla warfare.At 4:43am on 4 January 2009 a magnitude 7.6 earthquake struck Manokwari. Felt as far away as Australia
column17: the 35 km deep earthquake killed four people
column19: 000 people were left without power. Local residents were evacuated to Manokwari Military Academy in order to seek shelter from possible tsunamis and aftershocks that were felt throughout the day. Damage occurred to the Mutiara Hotel
column21: and several other buildings. Manokwari Regional Airport had significant damage
column23: and all four deaths resulted there. The Indonesian government sent a team of seven doctors to Manokwari to assist with the injured. Originally
column24: the team was projected to be ten people
column25: but due to the severe damage of the runway only seven were able to be transported in.  This was not unlike the previous quakes on 10 October 2002 when another 7.6 magnitude quake shook the region. In 1996 similar quakes also halted progress in the local region but there is no record of the recorded magnitude.On 14 April 2010
column27: a Boeing 737-300 (registration PK-MDF) with 103 persons on board
column28: broke into pieces as it bounced off the tarmac at Rendani Airport near Manokwari after landing in poor weather. The tail of the aircraft broke off and came to rest in the creek off the northern end of Runway 35. All passengers survived
column29: but 21 injured people were admitted to hospital. The flight originated in Sorong
column31: Manokwari experienced a violent protest which saw the provincial legislature building torched
column32: with the protest being part of the 2019 Papua protests.

column1: Manokwari is three meters above sea level on the coast of West Papua. Its average temperature is 26.3 °C (79.3 °F) and its temperature fluctuation is only 1 °C. It receives 2
column2: 597 mm (102.2 in) of rain per year
column3: approximately 216 mm (8.5 in) per month. It is located 52 minutes (0.87 degrees
column4: slightly less than 100 km) south of the equator and has an 86.3% average humidity. The annual sunshine hours are 2127; an average of 5.8 hours of sunlight per day. To date
column5: there are no recorded days of frost or snowfall in Manokwari.

column1: There are over twenty-four different tribal groups living in Manokwari. Each tribe has its own unique language and culture. The most prominent of the tribal groups are the Asmat and the Dani tribes people. The traditional house of Papua is the Honai
column2: a rounded house made of a wood and grass roof covering. Due to the variety of cultures in Manokwari
column3: several different regional instruments have been popularized to include the Atowo
column4: Tifa and the Fu. Manokwari is an urbanized region
column5: but in several of the regencies you can still find traditional garb. A Koteka is a hollowed out gourd used by tribesmen to cover their genitals. These tribal people are well known for their wooden sculptures of virility and beauty. These sculptures are sold both locally and globally and are part of Manokwari's exports. Among the other tribes are Kuri

column1: The State University of Papua was established on 3 November 2000. This university was created to help with the local education of the people of Papua. Among their achievements is the Beccariana
column2: an academic journal published by the university. This publication contains all the research done by the university in the field of herbalism. The university is strategically located on a hill facing the town
column3: surrounded by a dense tropical rain forest. This allows the researchers instant access to the biological samples and case studies.

column1: The land flatworm Platydemus manokwari was named after the town (where it was found) by French zoologist de Beauchamp in 1962.
One tourist site is the white
column2: sandy Doreri Bay Beach which has calm
column3: shallow water and is very safe for swimming.

column1: Arfak range nature reserve in the south of Manokwari is a popular tourist destination for visitors who are interested in hiking
column2: birding and wildlife watching. Tropical rainforest that covers most of the mountains is the natural habitat of various species of animals including cuscus possum
column5: magnificent riflebird as well as king bird of paradise. Susnguakti forest located in the south of the city is a popular destination for nature lovers who like camping and seeing the bio-diversity of the montane forest. Charles Roring is a tourist guide who regularly organizes birds of paradise and wildlife watching tours to Susnguakti forest of Manokwari.

column1: Manokwari has a road to connect from the city center
Manokwari Port on Banjarmasin Street operates 24 hours a day.
Manokwari has an airport called Rendani Airport
column2: The distance between Rendani Airport to downtown Manokwari is about 5 km distance.
